p: Commonly named umbellifers, the species from this group are grouped into more than 400 genera and 3500 species. The members of this vast family are present worldwide, being more abundant in temperate regions. While many species of this group are poisonous (e.g., poison hemlock), others are extensively used vegetables (parsley, carrot, celery, and fennel), spices, and herbs (e.g., anise, dill, coriander, caraway, cumin).
